intro: Orthosiphon retinervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined horse-herb, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with prominent, reticulate venation. Its small, tubular flowers are typically arranged in spikes and bloom in shades of white or pale purple. Orthosiphon retinervis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
